product_name: DIMEGentle Jelly Cleanser with Lycopene + Coconut Extract
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackGet the deep cleanse you've always wanted with DIME's Gentle Jelly Cleanser: Lycopene + Coconut Extract, providing deep cleansing for the skin, followed by a soothing feeling.
details: DetailsBenefitsRemoves dirt, oil, and makeupHydrates and soothes after cleansingAids in softening skin texture after consistent useEWG VERIFIEDKey IngredientsCoconut & Vitamin E: A composite blend of naturally derived surfactants from coconut and Vitamin E is infused into the formula. It serves as a gentle, deep cleanser leaving the skin soft to the touch and eliminating the tight, dry feeling typically experienced following the use of harsh surfactants.Strawberry Oil & Lycopene: These two ingredients play a role in the after-cleansing experience. Strawberry Oil gives the cleanser a refreshing, uplifting aroma, while Lycopene, a carotene derived from tomatoes, assists in fighting any free radical damage that could harm the skin throughout the day.Formulated WithoutSulfates: DIME [roducts never contain skin irritating ingredients such as sulfates. Sulfate-free products are gentle on the skin and can help decrease the chances of an allergic reaction.Parabens: Certain parabens have been linked to hormone disruption. DIME prohibits all parabens, including Ethylparaben, Butylparaben, Isobutylparaben, Isopropylparaben, Methylparaben, and Propylparaben.Phthalates: Certain phthalates (like Dibutyl Phthalate, aka DBP, or DEHP, and DEP) appear on product labels, but most typically remain unlisted, hiding under the term “fragrance.” Since some phthalates have been linked to hormone disruption, DIME avoids them.Item 2603230How To UseUse in the morning and at night as the first step in your skincare routine. Wet face and apply cleanser to fingertips. Using a circular motion, work the cleanser into a consistent lather over the face and neck. Rinse with warm water and gently pat skin dry. For best results, use daily.As a Conscious Beauty brand, DIME features sustainable packaging. Once product is empty, twist off cap, rinse bottle, and toss into recycling bin.IngredientsWater, Decyl Glucoside, Coco Glucoside, Glycerin, Glyceryl Oleate, Hydrolyzed Wheat Protein, Xanthan Gum, Fragaria Chiloensis (Strawberry) Oil, Lycopene, Tocopherol, Phenylpropanol, Ethylhexylglycerin.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use in the morning and at night as the first step in your skincare routine. Wet face and apply cleanser to fingertips. Using a circular motion, work the cleanser into a consistent lather over the face and neck. Rinse with warm water and gently pat skin dry. For best results, use daily.As a Conscious Beauty brand, DIME features sustainable packaging. Once product is empty, twist off cap, rinse bottle, and toss into recycling bin.

reviews.headline: Best face Cleanser ever
reviews.comments: My skin feels incredibly soft and plump after using this cleanser. Dime is the best product that has come into my life.

reviews.headline: smells bad doesn't clean broke out
reviews.comments: It smelled bad, didn't clean well, and I broke out from it. Glad it was only a sample, I tossed it. Ew.

reviews.headline: please no the smell.
reviews.comments: inital thoughts was that it smelt like a wet diaper it was really bad and then my face smelt like the cleanser hours after i washed my face even though i put other products on. after i washed it, my face felt almost like hardened. idk how to explain it but it felt like almost too firm but only in some areas it was really weird. i got this as a sample and safe to say i wont be getting the full size version.

reviews.headline: Smells awful!
reviews.comments: Although the cleanser felt okay on my skin, the smell was AWFUL. I definitely should've listened to the reviews saying the same thing. I just can't get past the smell.

reviews.headline: not a good cleanser
reviews.comments: this smelled weird (like fruit going bad) and didn't do a very good job of cleansing.

reviews.headline: It smells Bad, REALLY BAD!
reviews.comments: I don't know how anyone could use it and not notice the smell. The texture of it was fine, but I am not sure I can get by the smell to try it a 2nd time. It states coconut extract is in the product, but I sure don't smell it! There are a lot of great cleansers out there (some with scent and some not) but this is one to avoid!

reviews.headline: Smell
reviews.comments: This cleanser feels okay on my dry skin but i can not get past the scent!!

reviews.headline: The smell…..Just no
reviews.comments: I have yet to find a Dime product I dont like, but I HAVE to switch cleansers! I can't get pass the smell! So, so bad!!

reviews.headline: Best cleanser I've found for 55 yo skin
reviews.comments: Love this cleanser! Took care of the little bumps on my chin line. Face feels clean without feeling tight.

reviews.headline: Just ok
reviews.comments:
Just ok
I prefer the other cleanser

reviews.headline: A no for the celiac girlies
reviews.comments: I got a sample of this and loved how it made my skin feel. That was until I looked at the ingredient list and realized there's hydrolized wheat protein in it! If this was gluten free, I would have purchased. A loss for the celiac girlies.

reviews.headline: Great cleanser
reviews.comments: I have super sensitive and dry skin in the winter, and this has been perfect. It has a very light citrus smell and cleanses the face well without drying it out. I'm not very acne prone so I can't speak on that part, but great for sensitive skin!

reviews.headline: Disgusting
reviews.comments: This smells straight up like throwup.(ulta won't let me submit the v-word???) Disgusting and unusable.

reviews.headline: Best cleanser I've used in a long time!
reviews.comments: I love this face wash! I do not think the scent is unpleasant at all, as some of the other comments suggested. My skin felt amazing after one wash. I will definitely be buying this again!

reviews.headline: Horrible smell!
reviews.comments: I purchased based on how many stars and reviews however, i don't know how anyone managed to get by the smell.  I should have read the comments. I tried several times to use this product but the second I smelled it i just couldn't. I've never used a product remotely close to how bad this product smells. Yuck!!!

reviews.headline: might be allergic to decyl glucoside?
reviews.comments: i wanted to try out this cleanser because of the small ingredients list, including lycopene. However after a week of using, my hands have become EXTREMELY dry. like nothing is helping the dryness. my skin has also felt dry, but it wasn't as noticeable at first. I think having Decyl Glucocide as the 2nd ingredient was not a good moon. that particular surfactant can be extremely drying, depending on the skin ttype. it's used to commonly in cleansers, but it's not usually the 2nd on the list...use with caution is all I'm saying.

reviews.headline: Can't take the smell
reviews.comments:
I am returning sadly , i just cant get past the smell i had high hopes for this since i love the ceramide cream not even sure if that is still available 
I really didnt feel anythung special about this cleanser , maybe its for younger skin , not sure

reviews.headline: Can't take the smell
reviews.comments:
I am returning sadly , i just cant get past the smell i had high hopes for this since i love the ceramide cream not even sure if that is still available 
I really didnt feel anythung special about this cleanser , maybe its for younger skin , not sure

reviews.headline: Wow…
reviews.comments: Overrated and overpriced. Smells great, lightweight, lathers fine, feels like its cleaning the skin - although not sure - but holy crap is this drying after rinsing off. I have oily acne prone skin, that is more combination now that Im using certain products. This makes my face dry and dull looking. A no go!

reviews.headline: Smells AWFUL
reviews.comments: This cleanser does a really good job of cleaning my skin and does work really well, but I cannot stand the smell. it has such a strong odor, i literally had to hold my breath using it so i wouldnt smell it. I wish I liked this product more because it works well, but i cant get over the smell.

faceoff_positive.comments: I've struggled with facial skin issues since 2015. I've seen 6 dermatologists and been diagnosed with rosacea, eczema, adult acne or a combination of those items. I've been prescribed topical creams including steroids and antibiotics and a 30 day round of doxycylene (an oral antibiotic). None of those items worked. I've tried nearly every product on the market for sensitive, rosacea and or eczema prone skin. Nothing worked, until I found Dime. I was tired of trying products and being disappointed in the results so I stopped trying for a while and kept seeing adds about Dime. Then my friends started recommending it so I caved and tried it. I AM SO GLAD I DID. My face hasn't looked or felt this good in 8 years and it took only days to start seeing results. I use the regimine pictured. Morning: Jelly Cleanser, Probiotic Gel, Lumosity Gel. Night: the same and I add the Restorative Cream. The Jelly Cleanser is super lightweight and feels calming on the skin. I love how easily it is to spread around and the slight foaming it has. It's also super effective at getting off all my makeup, the first time.
faceoff_positive.headline: So, So Good

faceoff_negative.comments: Started using Dime products back in December of 2023 to help clear up cystic acne. I have tried both this product and their foam cleanser along with their serums and moisturizs. After about 7-8 months of consistent use I'm starting to see a difference but it hasnt stopped breakouts entirely. However, this company's customer service (Dime, not Ulta) is the overall reason for the 2 star review. I chatted with someone on their website for technical support and it was like texting with a snobby teenage girl who kept using "like" and passive aggressive comments - I was shocked at how unprofessional the conversation was. It was extremely off putting and has turned me away from wanting to continue use of their brand. Sounds silly, but if their team has a dont care attitude, it doesn't feel like something I want to support or continue use of.
faceoff_negative.headline: It's ok
